intro: Leptocarpus marlothii, commonly known as the Cape York lily, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Araceae and is characterized by its striking, spatulate-shaped leaves and showy inflorescences. The plant typically grows in wet, swampy areas and is often found in the coastal regions of northern Queensland. Its flowers are usually green or yellowish with a white spathe, and it produces small, fleshy berries. Leptocarpus marlothii is an important component of the local flora and is adapted to the tropical and subtropical climates of its native habitat.
